title: Thai Noodle Stir-fry
summary: Thai Noodle Stir-fry might be just the Asian recipe you are searching for. One serving contains 127 calories, 9g of protein, and 5g of fat. For $1.38 per serving, you get a side dish that serves 10. This recipe from mrjhn24.blogspot.com has 1 fans. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free diet. Head to the store and pick up thai chili, shiitake mushrooms, onion, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 22 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 66%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Thai Shrimp Stir Fry with Zucchini, Thai Noodle Stir-fry, and Simple Thai Peanut Noodle Stir Fry + Exciting News.

winePairing.pairingText: Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are my top picks for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. One wine you could try is Lawson's Dry Hills Gewurztraminer. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 18 dollars.

productMatches.title: Lawson's Dry Hills Gewurztraminer
productMatches.description:
The 2009 Lawson's Dry Hills Gew√ºrztraminer is a wonderful expression of a great vintage. The wine is
luscious and round with gentle acidity, balanced by a hint of sweetness(9.2g/L). Lemon peel,
marmalade, candyfloss, coriander, ginger and floral notes can all be found on the nose. The palate is
mouthfilling and rich with lovely concentration. Lychee, lemon and Turkish delight flavours lead on to a
long spicy finish. As the wine develops it will become more expressive on the nose and increasingly
complex.
